Package model

Class Fleet

java.lang.Object
model.Fleet
public class Fleet
extends java.lang.Object

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    (package private) boolean checkAllShipsPlaced()
    Checks if all Ships have been placed.
    (package private) boolean checkFleetDefeat()
    Checks if all ships in this Fleet have been sunk.
    (package private) boolean checkHit​(Position p)
    Checks if a Position is in the list of hits.
    (package private) boolean checkMiss​(Position p)
    Checks if a Position is in the list of misses.
    private void checkOtherShips​(Position pos, Orientation o, Level level)
    Checks if the currentShip could be placed at a certain Position with a certain Orientation without having any adjacent ships.
    (package private) boolean checkPosition​(Position pos, Level level)
    Checks if a Position is in bounds for a board defined by Level.
    private void checkShip​(Position pos, Orientation o, Level level)
    Checks if the currentShip could be placed at a certain Position with a certain Orientation without getting out of bounds.
    private java.util.List<java.lang.Boolean> checkShot​(Position pos)
    Checks if a shot in a certain Position would hit any Ship.
    (package private) FleetDTO getDTO()
    Creates a FleetDTO instance which has the same attributes as this instance of Fleet.
    (package private) org.json.JSONObject getState()
    Returns a JSONObject instance containing the following values: fleet: a JSONArray with the information returned by the method Ship.getState() of each ship in fleet. misses: a JSONArray with the information returned by the method Position.getState() of each position in misses. hits: a JSONArray with the information returned by the method Position.getState() of each position in hits. occupied: a JSONArray with the information returned by the method Position.getState() of each position in occupied.
    (package private) static Fleet parse​(org.json.JSONObject info, Level level)
    Given the information contained in a JSONObject, this method creates an instance of Fleet.
    (package private) void placeShip​(int i, Position pos, Orientation o, Level level)
    Places a Ship after checking that the Position is correct.
    (package private) void placeShip​(Position pos, Orientation o, Level level)
    This method places a Ship similarly to placeShip(int, Position, Orientation, Level).
    (package private) java.util.List<java.lang.Boolean> receiveShot​(Position pos)
    Checks if a shot at a certain Position would hit a Ship making use of checkShot(Position).
    (package private) void setCurrentShip​(int i)
    Changes the currentShip and the currentIndex to that of i.
    private void updateCurrentShip()
    Changes both the currentIndex and the currentShip to the next one in the list of ships.

  • Method Details

    • parse

      static Fleet parse​(org.json.JSONObject info, Level level) throws GameParseException, org.json.JSONException
      Given the information contained in a JSONObject, this method creates an instance of Fleet.
      Parameters:
      info - the JSONObject which contains the data.
      level - the Level that will be used to check if data is correct.
      Returns:
      the instance of Fleet with its attributes set according to the provided data.
      Throws:
      GameParseException - if the provided data contains incorrect or inconsistent values.
      org.json.JSONException - if the JSONObject doesn't contain all needed keys.

    • placeShip

      void placeShip​(int i, Position pos, Orientation o, Level level) throws CommandExecuteException
      Places a Ship after checking that the Position is correct.
      Parameters:
      i - an int that represents the index of the ship.
      pos - the Position of the ship to be placed.
      o - the Orientation of the ship to be placed.
      level - the Level needed to place the ship.
      Throws:
      CommandExecuteException - if any of the methods called throw this exception.

    • placeShip

      void placeShip​(Position pos, Orientation o, Level level) throws CommandExecuteException
      This method places a Ship similarly to placeShip(int, Position, Orientation, Level). In this case, the placed ship is the currentShip.
      Throws:
      CommandExecuteException

    • checkShip

      private void checkShip​(Position pos, Orientation o, Level level) throws CommandExecuteException
      Checks if the currentShip could be placed at a certain Position with a certain Orientation without getting out of bounds. If it is not possible, a CommandExecuteException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      pos - the Position where the ship would be placed.
      o - the Orientation that the ship would have.
      level - the Level used to check if the ship is in bounds.
      Throws:
      CommandExecuteException - if the ship could not be placed.

    • checkOtherShips

      private void checkOtherShips​(Position pos, Orientation o, Level level) throws CommandExecuteException
      Checks if the currentShip could be placed at a certain Position with a certain Orientation without having any adjacent ships. If it is not possible, a CommandExecuteException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      pos - the Position where the ship would be placed.
      o - the Orientation that the ship would have.
      level - the Level used to check if the ship is in bounds.
      Throws:
      CommandExecuteException - if the ship could not be placed.

    • checkPosition

      boolean checkPosition​(Position pos, Level level)
      Checks if a Position is in bounds for a board defined by Level.
      Parameters:
      pos - the Position to check.
      level - the Level where the position is checked.
      Returns:
      true if the position if in bounds, false otherwise.

    • checkShot

      private java.util.List<java.lang.Boolean> checkShot​(Position pos)
      Checks if a shot in a certain Position would hit any Ship. If so, it also returns if the ship is sunk.
      Parameters:
      pos - the Position to check.
      Returns:
      a List containing two Boolean values indicating if any Ship was hit and if it was sunk.

    • receiveShot

      java.util.List<java.lang.Boolean> receiveShot​(Position pos)
      Checks if a shot at a certain Position would hit a Ship making use of checkShot(Position). It then adds the position to the misses list or to the hits list, depending on the check.
      Parameters:
      pos - the Position to check.
      Returns:
      a List containing two Boolean values indicating if any Ship was hit and if it was sunk.

    • checkMiss

      boolean checkMiss​(Position p)
      Checks if a Position is in the list of misses.
      Parameters:
      p - the Position to check.
      Returns:
      true if the position is in the list, false otherwise.

    • checkHit

      boolean checkHit​(Position p)
      Checks if a Position is in the list of hits.
      Parameters:
      p - the Position to check.
      Returns:
      true if the position is in the list, false otherwise.

    • checkFleetDefeat

      boolean checkFleetDefeat()
      Checks if all ships in this Fleet have been sunk.
      Returns:
      true if all ships have been sunk, false otherwise.

    • updateCurrentShip

      private void updateCurrentShip()
      Changes both the currentIndex and the currentShip to the next one in the list of ships.

    • getState

      org.json.JSONObject getState()
      Returns a JSONObject instance containing the following values:
      • fleet: a JSONArray with the information returned by the method Ship.getState() of each ship in fleet.
      • misses: a JSONArray with the information returned by the method Position.getState() of each position in misses.
      • hits: a JSONArray with the information returned by the method Position.getState() of each position in hits.
      • occupied: a JSONArray with the information returned by the method Position.getState() of each position in occupied.
      Returns:
      a JSONObject with said values.

    • getDTO

      FleetDTO getDTO()
      Creates a FleetDTO instance which has the same attributes as this instance of Fleet.
      Returns:
      a FleetDTO created from this fleet.

    • setCurrentShip

      void setCurrentShip​(int i)
      Changes the currentShip and the currentIndex to that of i.
      Parameters:
      i - an int that represents the index that will be set.

    • checkAllShipsPlaced

      boolean checkAllShipsPlaced()
      Checks if all Ships have been placed.
      Returns:
      true if all ships in this Fleet have been placed, false otherwise.
